recipes.title: Berry Sparkler Mocktail
recipes.menu: Bright berries with sparkling juice and a citrusy fizz.

sections.ingredients_html:
• 1 cup frozen mixed berries (thawed slightly)
  • 500 ml non-alcoholic sparkling grape juice or sparkling apple juice
  • 200 ml lemonade or ginger ale
  • 2-4 fresh strawberries (for garnish)
  • Ice cubes, as needed
sections.method_html:
1. Divide the thawed mixed berries between two tall glasses (about 1/2 cup per glass).
  2. Lightly muddle the berries with a spoon to release some juice, keeping them mostly whole.
  3. Fill each glass halfway with ice cubes.
  4. Pour 250 ml of sparkling grape or apple juice into each glass, then top with 100 ml of lemonade or ginger ale.
  5. Stir gently to combine. Garnish each glass with a sliced strawberry on the rim and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Caprese Salad with Balsamic Glaze
recipes.menu: Tomatoes and mozzarella with basil and balsamic.

sections.ingredients_html:
• 3-4 ripe tomatoes (about 400 g), sliced into rounds
  • 200 g bocconcini or fresh mozzarella, sliced into rounds
  • 1 punnet fresh basil leaves (about 20-30 leaves)
  • 2 tbsp balsamic glaze
  • Optional: 1 tbsp pesto (for drizzling)
  • 4-6 slices sourdough or baguette (for serving)
sections.method_html:
1. On a serving platter or two plates, alternate slices of tomato and mozzarella in a circular or linear pattern.
  2. Tuck fresh basil leaves between the slices for even distribution.
  3. Drizzle evenly with the balsamic glaze (and pesto if using). Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  4. If desired, lightly toast the sourdough slices at 180 C for 5 minutes.
  5. Serve immediately with the bread on the side for scooping or dipping.

recipes.title: Chocolate-Dipped Strawberries with Chantilly Cream
recipes.menu: Glossy chocolate berries with vanilla-scented cream.

sections.ingredients_html:
• 1 punnet fresh strawberries (about 250 g), washed and dried
  • 150 g dark or milk chocolate melts
  • 300 ml thickened cream
  • 2 tbsp icing sugar
  • 1 tsp vanilla essence
sections.method_html:
1. Line a plate or tray with baking paper. Melt the chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl in 30-second bursts, stirring between each, until smooth.
  2. Holding each strawberry by the stem, dip halfway into the melted chocolate. Let excess drip off, then place on the prepared tray.
  3. Refrigerate the dipped strawberries for 10 minutes to set.
  4. Meanwhile, whip the thickened cream with the icing sugar and vanilla until soft peaks form.
  5. Serve the set strawberries with a dollop or piped swirl of chantilly cream on the side.

recipes.title: Coconut Sago with Lime-Glossed Pineapple
recipes.menu: Silky coconut pudding and bright tropical fruit close the menu with a light but luxe finish.

sections.ingredients_html:
• 80 g sago pearls
  • 250 ml water
  • 400 ml coconut milk
  • 2 tbsp sugar
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 250 g pineapple, diced
  • 1 tbsp lime juice
  • 1 tsp lime zest
  • 1 tbsp toasted coconut flakes
  • 6 mint leaves
sections.method_html:
1. Rinse the sago pearls, then simmer in 250 ml water for 10 minutes, stirring often, until mostly translucent.
  2. Drain the sago, return it to the pan, add coconut milk, sugar, and salt, and cook for 3-4 minutes until glossy.
  3. In a small skillet over medium heat, cook the diced pineapple for 2-3 minutes until lightly caramelized.
  4. Add lime juice to the pineapple, toss for 30 seconds, then remove from heat.
  5. Spoon the warm coconut sago into bowls, top with lime-glossed pineapple, and finish with lime zest, toasted coconut flakes, and mint leaves.

recipes.title: Creamy Garlic Prawn Pasta
recipes.menu: Silky garlic cream with prawns and spinach.

sections.ingredients_html:
• 250 g raw prawns (peeled and deveined)
  • 200 g fresh fettuccine or linguine
  • 2 garlic cloves, minced
  • 300 ml thickened cream
  • 2 cups baby spinach (about 100 g)
  • 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese, plus extra for serving
  • 1 tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tbsp butter
  • Optional: Pinch of chilli flakes
sections.method_html:
1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook according to packet instructions (usually 3-4 minutes for fresh). Drain and set aside, reserving 1/2 cup pasta water.
  2. In a large frying pan over medium heat, warm the olive oil and butter. Add the garlic (and chilli flakes if using) and saute for 1 minute until fragrant.
  3. Add the prawns and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until pink and opaque.
  4. Pour in the thickened cream and bring to a gentle simmer for 2-3 minutes to thicken slightly. Stir in the baby spinach until wilted, about 1 minute.
  5. Add the cooked pasta and parmesan to the pan. Toss to combine, adding a splash of reserved pasta water if needed. Season with salt and pepper.
  6. Divide between two bowls, top with extra parmesan, and serve hot.

recipes.title: Crispy Chicken with Lemon-Caper Butter, Parmesan Polenta & Garlicky Greens
recipes.menu: Crisp-skinned chicken, silky polenta, bright lemon-caper butter.

sections.ingredients_html:
• 2 chicken thighs (skin-on, bone-in or boneless)
  • Salt and black pepper (for chicken, polenta, and greens)
  • 4 tsp olive oil (1 tbsp for chicken, 1 tsp for greens)
  • 30-40 g butter
  • 1 tbsp capers, drained
  • 1 lemon (zest + 2 tbsp juice)
  • 2 small garlic cloves (1 finely grated for lemon-caper butter, optional; 1 sliced for greens)
  • 1 tbsp chopped parsley (or a small pinch of chopped sage)
  • 1/2 cup instant polenta
  • 2 cups water (or 1 cup water + 1 cup milk)
  • 30 g parmesan, finely grated
  • 1 bunch broccolini or 2 handfuls baby spinach
sections.method_html:
1. Season chicken well with salt and pepper.
  2. Heat olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Place chicken skin-side down and cook until deeply golden and crisp, about 8-12 minutes (reduce heat if it's browning too fast).
  3. Flip chicken and cook through, 6-10 minutes more (boneless cooks faster). Rest on a plate, loosely covered.
  4. Polenta: Bring water (or water + milk) to a simmer. Whisk in polenta in a steady stream. Cook 2-3 minutes, stirring, until thick. Stir in parmesan, season, and cover to keep warm.
  5. Greens: In a second pan (or after chicken comes out), warm olive oil, add sliced garlic for 20-30 seconds, then add greens and cook until just tender. Season lightly.
  6. Lemon-caper butter: In the chicken pan (leave the tasty bits), reduce heat to low. Add butter, capers, lemon zest, and garlic (if using). Swirl until foamy. Add lemon juice, taste, and adjust salt.
  7. Spoon polenta onto plates, add greens, top with chicken, then drizzle over lemon-caper butter. Finish with parsley (or a touch of sage).
sections.notes_html: • Easy vegetarian swap: Replace chicken with thick slices of halloumi or large field mushrooms. Sear until golden, then use the same lemon-caper butter.

recipes.title: Espresso Tiramisu Cups (No Alcohol)
recipes.menu: Creamy mascarpone layers with espresso-soaked biscuits and cocoa.

sections.ingredients_html:
• 125 g mascarpone
  • 150 ml thickened cream
  • 2 tbsp icing sugar
  • 1 tsp vanilla extract
  • 1/2 cup strong espresso or very strong instant coffee, cooled
  • 8-10 sponge fingers (savoiardi), broken to fit
  • 1-2 tbsp cocoa powder
  • Optional: Dark chocolate, finely grated (to finish)
sections.method_html:
1. Whip cream, icing sugar, and vanilla to soft peaks.
  2. Fold mascarpone through gently until smooth and thick.
  3. Dip sponge finger pieces quickly into cooled coffee (1-2 seconds per side).
  4. Layer coffee-dipped biscuits and mascarpone cream into two glasses. Aim for 2-3 layers.
  5. Chill for at least 30 minutes.
  6. Dust generously with cocoa just before serving. Add grated dark chocolate if you feel fancy.

recipes.title: Ginger Slice

sections.ingredients_html:
• 1 3/4 cups flour
  • 1 cup caster sugar
  • 125 g glace ginger
  • 1 egg
  • 150--185g butter
  • 30 g blanched almonds
sections.method_html:
1. Sift flour, then add sugar, and chopped ginger.
  2. Mix in melted butter and egg. Press into well.
  3. Pour mixture into greased sandwich tin.
  4. Brush top with milk, decorate with almonds.
  5. Bake 45 minutes at 170C.
  6. Cool in tin, cut in wedges.

**Notes**

Very rich, small serves.

recipes.title: Miso-Butter Broccolini with Toasted Sesame Almonds
recipes.menu: Fast charred greens with nutty crunch and savory glaze for a restaurant-style small plate.

sections.ingredients_html:
• 250 g broccolini
  • 1 tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tbsp unsalted butter
  • 1 tbsp white miso paste
  • 1 tsp honey
  • 1 tbsp water
  • 1 tsp lime juice
  • 1 tsp lime zest
  • 20 g flaked almonds
  • 1 tbsp toasted sesame seeds
sections.method_html:
1. Heat a dry skillet over medium heat, toast the flaked almonds for 1-2 minutes, then transfer to a plate.
  2. Add olive oil to the same skillet, add broccolini, and cook for 3-4 minutes until blistered in spots.
  3. Add 1 tbsp water, cover for 1 minute, then uncover and cook until the water evaporates.
  4. Lower heat, add butter, miso paste, honey, and lime juice, and toss until the broccolini is evenly glazed.
  5. Plate the broccolini, finish with lime zest, toasted almonds, and sesame seeds, and serve hot.

recipes.title: Miso-Sesame Mushroom Lettuce Cups
recipes.menu: Savory glossy mushrooms in crisp lettuce cups deliver big umami and clean contrast with almost no cleanup.

sections.ingredients_html:
• 300 g Swiss brown mushrooms, finely chopped
  • 1 tbsp neutral oil
  • 2 tbsp white miso paste
  • 1 tbsp soy sauce
  • 2 tsp rice vinegar
  • 2 tsp caster sugar
  • 1 tsp sesame oil
  • 1 garlic clove, minced
  • 1 tsp grated ginger

  • 2 spring onions, thinly sliced
  • 1 tbsp toasted sesame seeds
sections.method_html:

  3. Stir in miso paste, soy sauce, rice vinegar, caster sugar, and sesame oil; cook for 2 minutes until glossy and lightly sticky.
  4. Spoon the hot mushroom mixture into butter lettuce leaves.
  5. Finish with spring onions and toasted sesame seeds, then serve immediately.

recipes.menu: Warm spiced pears, cool vanilla ricotta, and crisp walnut crunch finish the meal with elegant contrast.

sections.ingredients_html:
• 2 ripe pears, cored and sliced
  • 1 tbsp unsalted butter
  • 1 tbsp honey
  • 1/2 tsp ground cinnamon
  • 120 g ricotta
  • 1 tsp vanilla extract
  • 20 g walnuts, finely chopped
  • 1 tbsp sugar
  • 1 tsp lemon zest
  • 1 pinch sea salt
sections.method_html:
1. Toast walnuts, sugar, and sea salt in a dry skillet over medium heat for 2-3 minutes until fragrant, then transfer to a plate.
  2. In a small bowl, whisk ricotta and vanilla until smooth.
  3. Melt butter in the same skillet, add pears, honey, and cinnamon, and cook for 6-8 minutes until glossy and tender.
  4. Spoon vanilla ricotta into shallow bowls and top with warm pears and pan syrup.
  5. Finish with walnut crunch and lemon zest just before serving.

recipes.title: Whipped Feta Artichoke Toasts with Lemon
recipes.menu: Creamy whipped feta and warm lemony artichokes on crisp toast for a savory first bite.

sections.ingredients_html:
• 120 g feta
  • 80 g ricotta
  • 1 tsp lemon zest
  • 1 tbsp lemon juice
  • 1 small garlic clove, finely grated
  • 1 tbsp olive oil, plus extra to drizzle
  • 1 cup jarred artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
  • 1 tbsp chopped parsley or basil
  • 4 slices sourdough
  • Freshly cracked black pepper
sections.method_html:
1. Toast the sourdough slices until golden and crisp.
  2. In a bowl, mash feta, ricotta, lemon zest, and half the lemon juice until creamy and spreadable.
  3. Warm olive oil in a small pan over medium heat, then cook artichokes with garlic for 2-3 minutes.
  4. Add remaining lemon juice and parsley, toss for 30 seconds, then turn off the heat.
  5. Spread whipped feta on the toasts, spoon warm artichokes over the top, and finish with black pepper and a light olive oil drizzle.
